TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SelectionRange extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a date selection range in a month calendar control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> is the date or dates selected and highlighted on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control. If only one date is selected, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End%2A> property values will be equal. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> can be changed by the user clicking a date while dragging the mouse pointer across the desired dates, or you can set the range in code. For example, you might want to have the user enter a date range into two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> controls or two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DateTimePicker> controls and set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> based on those dates.
## Examples The following example sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control based on two dates entered into two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> controls when a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> is clicked. This code assumes new instances of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control, two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> controls, and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> have been created on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>. You might consider adding code to validate the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Text%2A> assigned to the text boxes to verify that they contain valid dates.
[!code-cpp[Classic SelectionRange.SelectionRange1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic SelectionRange.SelectionRange1 Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic SelectionRange.SelectionRange1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic SelectionRange.SelectionRange1 Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic SelectionRange.SelectionRange1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic SelectionRange.SelectionRange1 Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End%2A> values are set to `null` when this constructor is used.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> object, sets its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End%2A> properties, and assigns the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> object to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionRange%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control. When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.DateChanged> event is raised, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End%2A> property values are displayed in the text boxes. This example assumes that you have a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> with two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> controls, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button>, and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange Members#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange Members/CPP/selectionrangeobj.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange Members#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange Members/CS/selectionrangeobj.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange Members#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange Members/VB/selectionrangeobj.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange range) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified selection range.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End%2A> property values are assigned the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End%2A> property values of the assigned <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> object.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> object, sets its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End%2A> properties, and assigns the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> object to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionRange%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control. When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.DateChanged> event is raised, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End%2A> property values are displayed in the text boxes. This example assumes that you have a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> with two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> controls, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button>, and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange Members#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange Members/CPP/selectionrangeobj.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange Members#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange Members/CS/selectionrangeobj.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange Members#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange Members/VB/selectionrangeobj.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.DateTime lower, valuetype System.DateTime upper) cil managed
Public Sub New (lower As DateTime, upper As DateTime)

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified beginning and ending dates.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > If the `lower`<xref:System.DateTime> value is greater than the `upper`<xref:System.DateTime> value, the `lower` value will be assigned to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End%2A> property instead of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start%2A> property.
## Examples The following example sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control based on two dates entered into two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> controls when a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> is clicked. This code assumes new instances of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control, two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> controls, and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> have been created on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>. You might consider adding code to validate the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Text%2A> assigned to the text boxes to verify that they contain valid dates.
[!code-cpp[Classic SelectionRange.SelectionRange1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic SelectionRange.SelectionRange1 Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic SelectionRange.SelectionRange1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic SelectionRange.SelectionRange1 Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic SelectionRange.SelectionRange1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic SelectionRange.SelectionRange1 Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ending date and time of the selection range.
Docs.value: The ending value of the range.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> object, sets its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End%2A> properties, and assigns the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> object to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionRange%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control. When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.DateChanged> event is raised, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End%2A> property values are displayed in the text boxes. This example assumes that you have a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> with two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> controls, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button>, and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control.

## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> object, sets its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End%2A> properties, and assigns the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange> object to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.SelectionRange%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control. This example assumes that you have a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> with two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> controls, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button>, and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.ToString%2A> method returns a string that includes the values for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.Start%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SelectionRange.End%2A> properties.
